column18: 01/05/2015: An assailant set fire to the Hudavendigar Mosque in Plovdiv city, Plovdiv province, Bulgaria. There were no casualties in the incident, but the mosque sustained damage. Police later arrested Viktor Alexandrov, who confessed to the attack.
column97: Petrol was used in the attack.
column108: The Hudavendigar Mosque was damaged in this attack.
column125: There is reason to doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria because the assailant stated that he was drunk during the incident and so may have lacked the necessary intention.
